description:
Tax-free allowance

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
73511 Trade tax statistics

Definition:
Pursuant to Section 6 of the Trade Tax Act, trade tax is
levied on business profits. The basic figure for this
generally is the business profit (Section 7 of the Trade Tax
Act) as determined for income tax or corporation tax. Since
trade tax is intended to take a business's objective earning
capacity into account  regardless of who earns the profit 
a number of additions or deductions are included in the
profit (or loss) (Section 8 et seqq. of the Trade Tax Act).
The business profit thus calculated must be rounded off to
the nearest 100 euros and be reduced by a tax-free allowance
of 24,500 euros for natural persons and partnerships. A tax-
free allowance of 5,000 euros is granted to (other) legal
persons governed by private or public law, associations
without legal capacity as defined by Section 2 (3), and
commercial business operations of enterprises otherwise
exempt from trade tax as specified by Section 3 nos. 5, 6,
8, 9, 15, 17, 21, 26, 27, 28, 29 of the Trade Tax Act.
